abstract.p: China Unicom expands size of its stock offering by about 10 percent; at top end of price range, Unicom's offering could now raise $5.05 billion, up from $4.57 billion; Unicom chairman Yang Xianzu comments (S)

block.p: Signaling its confidence a week before it goes public in New York and Hong Kong, China's second-largest telephone company, China Unicom, has expanded the size of its stock offering by about 10 percent. At the top end of the price range, Unicom's offering could now raise $5.05 billion, up from $4.57 billion. ''We find that investors are reacting quite positively,'' the company's chairman, Yang Xianzu, said in a video news conference in Hong Kong. Mr. Yang said Unicom was in discussions with several telecommunications companies about buying a block of the shares. He was in London meeting with prospective investors.
